Articles.Content:
Welcome,welcome fellow kerbonauts! Today i want to show my favourite rocket! The Proton K,as we all know was used to put the Salyut/Alamaz space stations into orbit  and is right now the soviets most reliable heavy lift rocket.It has three stages.So today in the space craft exchange i built a (sort off) Proton K,so here it is!

Edited May 15, 2016 by Jeb-head-mug kerman

The Proton K is a very cool design, but it would be nice to see a picture of your version here.

The unwritten forum rule is "no pics, no clicks", especially in the spacecraft exchange and mod sections. Get a free Imgur account f.e. to host your pictures and link them here. Its easy and comfortable.

Looking forward to see your design!
I see you have the "Stealth/Invisibility Paint" mod installed.

On 13 May 2016 at 7:48 PM, Frank_G said:

The Proton K is a very cool design, but it would be nice to see a picture of your version here.

The unwritten forum rule is "no pics, no clicks", especially in the spacecraft exchange and mod sections. Get a free Imgur account f.e. to host your pictures and link them here. Its easy and comfortable.

Looking forward to see your design!

Well yes i will add a picture today!
Tip: You can take screenshots in-game by hitting F1. Screenshots are saved to the "Screenshots" folder in your main KSP directory. That way, your pictures come out a lot nicer!

Pro-tip: use either the 2.5 meter separator or the 0.625 meter decoupler for rocket stages. The big decoupler is thick and ugly, but the separator is thin and doesn't ruin the shape. The 0.625 decoupler a can be hidden with some fairings or strategic use of the offset tool and the fact that they are smaller can be negated by adding a few struts between the lower and upper stages.

17 hours ago, mipmo said:

Tip: You can take screenshots in-game by hitting F1. Screenshots are saved to the "Screenshots" folder in your main KSP directory. That way, your pictures come out a lot nicer! 

Thanks a lot!

Oh yeah but how do i do ot on a mac?

13 minutes ago, Jeb-head-mug kerman said:

Thanks a lot!

Oh yeah but how do i do ot on a mac?

Command Shift 3 to take a screenshot of the whole screen and Command Shift 4 to select part of the screen.

You can also use "fn" + F1. "fn" +F2 to turn off the HUD. That will put a .png in the screenshot folder in your KSP main directory.

In case you didnt know... use fn with f3 to check your mission log, f5 to quicksave, f9 to quickload... just check your options menu. If an F-key is assigned, use it together with "fn", or switch it in your system settings (so the OSX function can be accessed with fn and the regular F-keys become the single key press - find that checkbox under the keyboard settings).

2 hours ago, Frank_G said:

You can also use "fn" + F1. "fn" +F2 to turn off the HUD. That will put a .png in the screenshot folder in your KSP main directory.

In case you didnt know... use fn with f3 to check your mission log, f5 to quicksave, f9 to quickload... just check your options menu. If an F-key is assigned, use it together with "fn", or switch it in your system settings (so the OSX function can be accessed with fn and the regular F-keys become the single key press - find that checkbox under the keyboard settings).

Thats a lot off help but how do i put it on imgur?

17 minutes ago, Jeb-head-mug kerman said:

Thats a lot off help but how do i put it on imgur?

Create an imgur account, then hit the upload button, you can either choose the classic search directories or just drag and drop
